msItem.title: Hrólfs saga kraka
msItem.rubric: Hrölffs Köngs Kraka saga Er Riede Dana vellde. og kemur hier fyrst fröda þättur.
msItem.incipit: Madur Er Neffndur Hälffdän Enn Annar Fröde. Brædur Tueir og konga syner, og stÿrde sijnu Rijke huor þeira. Häldän kongur var hijr og hægur giæfur og gödlyndur, Enn fröde könge var enn meste riffballde. Häldän ätte þriu born, tuo sune og eina döttur er Signij hiet, hun var ellst og var gifft Sæuare jalle.
msItem.explicit: Var haugur orpenn Effter Hrölff köng, og lagtt hiä honum suerded Sköffnungur og sinn haugur handa huorium kappa, og nockur vopnn hiä ad auku. og Endar hier suo loksinnz saugu hrölffz köngs kraka og kappa hans.
msItem.verse:
Vÿsa Magnus Jons Sonar til Gamanz.
Hrölffur krake, köngur j Danavellde mælltt er ei hiellde, ä mundar ellde, medann ad Liffde soma skÿn, Lÿst mine take, Loffed hanz enn i kuellde, og ad hinn fellde, ovffuinn sellde, Ägiæt dæminn siöle dÿr, view med sann, er vædtt vmm þann, rausnar freak affrekz mann, ad villdara fann, ei verda enn hann, vmm vero᷎lld i heijdur huo᷎rtt sem snÿr.

Ønnur hinns sama
Hrölffur kempann krake, king best make, Liffde leingst vmm spate, med lyst og heffdar kuake, hann þö rauna rake, veÿrde i Balldra take, vmm syder aff systur hrake, sikling skarft ä bake.
msItem.note: The saga text is incomplete, with several leaves missing between fols 8 and 9. The verses are laid out in two columns below the end of the saga.

Later foliation: Fols 3–17 are foliated 1–15 in red ink by Kålund. Fol. 18 is blank.
Average: Several leaves are stained. The MS leaves have been cropped, but with no apparent textual loss. Fols 3–5 have minor damage near the gutter with some text lost.

sourceDesc.decoDesc: The manuscript has a low level of decoration. A higher level of script is sometimes used at the beginning of new sections.

ul.li:
Fol. 2r: the envelope of a letter to Árni Magnússon, which reads:
Stör gofigum Virdug ligum og hatt ockt udum, hanns konglegur Marests Secreteranum herra Arna Magnus syne, mijnum mikes virdandi Elsku Rijkum og mio᷎g kyærum brodur þettad þienustu samlega og i göd og trauste. ad Skalhollte.
Fol. 2r, bottom right corner: the shelfmark AM 284, 4to is written in pen.

sourceDesc.bindingDesc: Plain modern binding in paper boards.

history.provenance: The manuscript may have come into Árni Magnússon's possession through Sigurður Jónsson, the brother of Magnús í Vigur. Magnús may therefore have copied the manuscript for his brother, or it may have been borrowed. Magnús Jónsson í Vigur (1637–1702): Commissioner, Scribe, Owner Sigurður Jónsson (1643–1730): Owner Árni Magnússon (1663–1730): Owner
